intro: Tetradenia brevispicata, commonly known as the narrow-headed tetradenia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow leaves, which are typically less than 5 centimeters in length. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
